alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Jones (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:24PM CDT until May 07 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EASTERN FISHER AND WESTERN JONES COUNTIES... At 923 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area...along and north of a Roby to Anson line...moving east at 20 mph. Between 3 and 4.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Anson, Hamlin, Roby, Hawley, Neinda, Noodle, Mccaulley, Sylvester, Longworth, The Intersection Of Us-180 And Ranch Road 126, Truby, Stith, Hodges, Funston and Busby. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... CO Rd. 444 crossing Noodle Creek and County Road 260 crossing Harmony Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
